brief_summary.textblock:
Most of the reports on hypnosis in the literature have focused on pain control during minor
      operations. With this study we aimed to evaluate the role of hypnosis on sedation for
      transesophageal echocardiography and compare it with commonly used sedative midazolam.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hypnosis vs Midazolam for Sedation for TEE

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  indications for TEE

          -  American Society of Anesthesiology (ASA) physical status I-III

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  mental illness,

          -  psychotropic medication use,

          -  hypersensitivity to drugs

          -  a body mass index over 30.

study_pop.textblock: patients admitting to cardiology department for transesophageal echocardiography (TEE)

intervention.description: The patients will be given 0.05mg/kg iv midazolam just before monitorization. During probing, in case of intolerance to the insertion of the probe, the increments of midazolam with 0.005mg/kg doses will be given.
A first hypnotic induction will be carried out the day before the procedure, next day, fifteen minutes before the procedure, a new induction will be performed.

facility.name: Bakirkoy Dr Sadi Konuk Training Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Hypnosis for Sedation in Transesophageal Echocardiography: Comparison With Midazolam

primary_outcome.measure: Sedative effects of hypnotherapy and the drug "midazolam" indicated by anxiety scores and bispectral index (BIS) monitoring

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: measurement of alertness after sedation with continuous performance test (CPT)

clinical_study.source: Bakirkoy Dr. Sadi Konuk Research and Training Hospital

lead_sponsor.agency: Bakirkoy Dr. Sadi Konuk Research and Training Hospital
